question.text:
Match the columns I and II, and choose the CORRECT combination from the options given.
 
Column I Column II
(a)  (i) Fucus
(b)  (ii) Laminaria
(c)  (iii) Polysiphonia

Find the CORRECT match.

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

solution.text: Fucus are large algae belonging to class Phaophyceae which can grow up to 100 meters. They bear disc shape holdfast which help them to attach to substratum and air bladder to make them light so that their frond can reach up to the surface of the sea to capture sunlight for photosynthesis. Polysiphonia is a red alga and highly branched.
